GT.content: absolute forgetting (oubli absolu) which unbinds (délie) absolutely or infinitely more than excuse, forgiveness, acquittal: certain experience of trace, cinder, ashes
GT.linkedContent: absolute forgetting (oubli absolu) which unbinds (délie) absolutely or infinitely more than excuse, forgiveness, acquittal: certain experience of trace, cinder, ashes

GT.content: forgetting and gift condition each other (unconditional)

madness linked to double bind as the bind & the non-bind or débandade: folie de la garde ou de la capitalisation hypermnésique, et folie de la dépense oublieuse; eats away at language, burns up word or meaning of “gift,” spreads its ashes w/out return; that which does not return to the father
GT.linkedContent: madness linked to double bind as the bind & the non-bind or débandade: folie de la garde ou de la capitalisation hypermnésique, et folie de la dépense oublieuse; eats away at language, burns up word or meaning of “gift,” spreads its ashes w/out return; that which does not return to the father

GT.content: annihilation of a remainder, as ashes sometimes testify, can play role of memory, of offering, of sacrifice
GT.linkedContent: annihilation of a remainder, as ashes sometimes testify, can play role of memory, of offering, of sacrifice

FK.content: [bottom w/out bottom of always virgin impassibility] khōra of tomorrow in languages we no longer, don’t yet, speak: makes way w/out generosity, neither divine, nor human > dispersion of ashes not promised there, nor death given
FK.linkedContent: [bottom w/out bottom of always virgin impassibility] khōra of tomorrow in languages we no longer, don’t yet, speak: makes way w/out generosity, neither divine, nor human > dispersion of ashes not promised there, nor death given

AF.content: the archaic impression Freud seeks almost no longer an archive, confuses itself w/ a footstep that leaves its still living mark on surface [see POR p. 19 (154) seize inaudible in a sort of poetic telephony, see what makes sight see], place of origin, when step still one w/ subjectile
AF.linkedContent: the archaic impression Freud seeks almost no longer an archive, confuses itself w/ a footstep that leaves its still living mark on surface [see POR p. 19 (154) seize inaudible in a sort of poetic telephony, see what makes sight see], place of origin, when step still one w/ subjectile

AF.content: instant when imprint yet to be abandoned by pressure of impression, pure auto-affection, indistinction btwn touching/touched, active/passive, an archive that would confuse itself w/ arkhē ——Freud dreams irreplaceable place, the very ash, condition of singularity, idiom, secret, testimony, trace no longer distinguishes itself from substrate > absolutely safe location
AF.linkedContent: instant when imprint yet to be abandoned by pressure of impression, pure auto-affection, indistinction btwn touching/touched, active/passive, an archive that would confuse itself w/ arkhē ——Freud dreams irreplaceable place, the very ash, condition of singularity, idiom, secret, testimony, trace no longer distinguishes itself from substrate > absolutely safe location

AF.content: holds, right on the ash, pressure of Gradiva’s so singular step
AF.linkedContent: holds, right on the ash, pressure of Gradiva’s so singular step

AF.content: no archive of the secret, by definition, it is the very ash of the archive
AF.linkedContent: no archive of the secret, by definition, it is the very ash of the archive

AF.content: we’ll always wonder what in this mal d’archive did Freud burn, what may have burned of his secret passions, w/out him, w/out name, w/out symptom, w/out knowledge, w/out even an ash
AF.linkedContent: we’ll always wonder what in this mal d’archive did Freud burn, what may have burned of his secret passions, w/out him, w/out name, w/out symptom, w/out knowledge, w/out even an ash

SPOM.content: Marx: “useless metal” of treasure, horde, becomes like burnt-out ashes (ausgebrannte Asche) of circulation, its caput mortuum; miser, speculator: a martyr to exchange value > dreams of pure exchange value
SPOM.linkedContent: Marx: “useless metal” of treasure, horde, becomes like burnt-out ashes (ausgebrannte Asche) of circulation, its caput mortuum; miser, speculator: a martyr to exchange value > dreams of pure exchange value

SPOM.content: ghosts and mortals can put the dead to rest, the dead cannot, it is impossible “and they must not do so,” this impossibility, the dead putting dead to rest [p. 31 “do not reduce testimony to knowledge”?], can take place, it is the ruin or the absolute ashes, it is total presence, absolute evil, Derrida exorcises, not to chase away but to grant ghosts the right to return (faire droit), revenant
SPOM.linkedContent: ghosts and mortals can put the dead to rest, the dead cannot, it is impossible “and they must not do so,” this impossibility, the dead putting dead to rest [p. 31 “do not reduce testimony to knowledge”?], can take place, it is the ruin or the absolute ashes, it is total presence, absolute evil, Derrida exorcises, not to chase away but to grant ghosts the right to return (faire droit), revenant

HASD.content: [letter always arrives?] always possible to call on God, to call assumed origin of all speech by name of God, God always names trace of singular event rendering speech possible, all apophatic discourse opens w/ prayer
HASD.linkedContent: [letter always arrives?] always possible to call on God, to call assumed origin of all speech by name of God, God always names trace of singular event rendering speech possible, all apophatic discourse opens w/ prayer

HASD.content: always presupposed event, déjà-là, trace of phrase indispensable, irreducible, trace has taken place, even if contaminated by repetition which confers on it code & intelligibility, even if it occurs only to efface itself, effacement will have taken place, even if its place is only in ashes, il y a là cendre
HASD.linkedContent: always presupposed event, déjà-là, trace of phrase indispensable, irreducible, trace has taken place, even if contaminated by repetition which confers on it code & intelligibility, even if it occurs only to efface itself, effacement will have taken place, even if its place is only in ashes, il y a là cendre

HASD.content: trace as possibility of finitude, finite & infinite cause of trace appears secondary, an effect of trace or differance (which is finite insofar as it is infinite)
HASD.linkedContent: trace as possibility of finitude, finite & infinite cause of trace appears secondary, an effect of trace or differance (which is finite insofar as it is infinite)

A.content: always culture of death (sometimes just to incinerate ashes)
A.linkedContent: always culture of death (sometimes just to incinerate ashes)

PP.content: first use of il y a là cendre, in reference to not losing Plato’s 2nd letter, which speaks of what he [Plato?] could never have written
PP.linkedContent: first use of il y a là cendre, in reference to not losing Plato’s 2nd letter, which speaks of what he [Plato?] could never have written

S.content: “I shall speak of ghost, of flame, and of ashes (je parlerai du revenant, de la flamme et des cendres)”
S.linkedContent: “I shall speak of ghost, of flame, and of ashes (je parlerai du revenant, de la flamme et des cendres)”

S.content: Valéry: knowledge devours everything, turns all to ash
S.linkedContent: Valéry: knowledge devours everything, turns all to ash

S.content: in Der Ister, Hölderlin calls to the fire, Jetzt komme, Feuer!, fire as what comes, call for to-come > acc. Heidegger, Hölderlin, the Beseeler, has been struck by God of light, gift of spirit as incineration, cremation, almost becoming ash [MOP & annihilation of trace]
S.linkedContent: in Der Ister, Hölderlin calls to the fire, Jetzt komme, Feuer!, fire as what comes, call for to-come > acc. Heidegger, Hölderlin, the Beseeler, has been struck by God of light, gift of spirit as incineration, cremation, almost becoming ash [MOP & annihilation of trace]

S.content: duplicity of Geist, as its evil ghost, brings forth question: is ash good or evil? whiteness of ash which belongs to destiny consumed and consuming (conflagration of flame)
S.linkedContent: duplicity of Geist, as its evil ghost, brings forth question: is ash good or evil? whiteness of ash which belongs to destiny consumed and consuming (conflagration of flame)

S.content: Heidegger: spirit flames devour, consume, everything, including the white of ash
S.linkedContent: Heidegger: spirit flames devour, consume, everything, including the white of ash

S.content: Trakl: “flame is the brother of the palest”
S.linkedContent: Trakl: “flame is the brother of the palest”

S.content: white of ash as des Zerstörerischen (the destruction) spirit deploys, as radical evil
S.linkedContent: white of ash as des Zerstörerischen (the destruction) spirit deploys, as radical evil

SH.content: readability effaces the date, the very thing which it offers for reading, date must conceal w/in itself stigma of singularity if it is to last longer (lasting is the poem), only chance of spectral return, commemoration of date’s annihilation, kind of nothing or ash > ash awaits us
SH.linkedContent: readability effaces the date, the very thing which it offers for reading, date must conceal w/in itself stigma of singularity if it is to last longer (lasting is the poem), only chance of spectral return, commemoration of date’s annihilation, kind of nothing or ash > ash awaits us

SH.content: annulment in the annulation of return belongs to movement of dating
SH.linkedContent: annulment in the annulation of return belongs to movement of dating

SH.content: signature not only recalls the vanished as vanished, the singular event, its ash > it gathers together a conjunction of singularities, a partaking in future of same date
SH.linkedContent: signature not only recalls the vanished as vanished, the singular event, its ash > it gathers together a conjunction of singularities, a partaking in future of same date

SH.content: date may always become no one’s, nothing’s date, the essence w/out essence of ash
SH.linkedContent: date may always become no one’s, nothing’s date, the essence w/out essence of ash

SH.content: name partakes in this destiny of ash along w/ date, not empirical, is part of its readability ——mourning: reading itself > readability: tribute of lost singularity (“beauty” pays)
SH.linkedContent: name partakes in this destiny of ash along w/ date, not empirical, is part of its readability ——mourning: reading itself > readability: tribute of lost singularity (“beauty” pays)

SH.content: religion before religion: blessing of dates, names, ashes
SH.linkedContent: religion before religion: blessing of dates, names, ashes

SH.content: date is mad, always more or less than what it says it is, we are mad for dates, those ashes which dates are, remains w/out being > music, Sichelschrift
SH.linkedContent: date is mad, always more or less than what it says it is, we are mad for dates, those ashes which dates are, remains w/out being > music, Sichelschrift

SH.content: unreadable is readable as unreadable, shibboleth transmitted to a few during finite time of incineration, heart to heart, mouth to ear, hand to hand, still universal by right (legible, coded, troped) > madness of fire: consumes a date from w/in > renders ash from 1st moment
SH.linkedContent: unreadable is readable as unreadable, shibboleth transmitted to a few during finite time of incineration, heart to heart, mouth to ear, hand to hand, still universal by right (legible, coded, troped) > madness of fire: consumes a date from w/in > renders ash from 1st moment

SH.content: trace or ash: these names stand for other names, a date’s destiny is that of every proper name: is there any other desire than dating, commemorating?
SH.linkedContent: trace or ash: these names stand for other names, a date’s destiny is that of every proper name: is there any other desire than dating, commemorating?

SH.content: a date, to become what it is, must give itself to be read in ash, in the nonbeing of its being
SH.linkedContent: a date, to become what it is, must give itself to be read in ash, in the nonbeing of its being

SH.content: poem’s desire or gift, the date is born, in movement of blessing, toward ash
SH.linkedContent: poem’s desire or gift, the date is born, in movement of blessing, toward ash

SH.content: desert: where no one would be left to bless the ashes
SH.linkedContent: desert: where no one would be left to bless the ashes

SH.content: [MOP] Celan: Aschenkelle (ash-ladle) draws from tub [better than manger/trough] of being, launders > soapy; ash uses up being, is not a being-that-remains, there is ash, but ash is not
SH.linkedContent: [MOP] Celan: Aschenkelle (ash-ladle) draws from tub [better than manger/trough] of being, launders > soapy; ash uses up being, is not a being-that-remains, there is ash, but ash is not

SH.content: via Celan, so much ash to be blessed
SH.linkedContent: via Celan, so much ash to be blessed

SH.content: ash calls to night, night calls to ash
Jewish language, poetic language, this essence promises itself only in dis-identification (in the expropriation of the nothing, non-essence—[ashes?])
SH.linkedContent: Jewish language, poetic language, this essence promises itself only in dis-identification (in the expropriation of the nothing, non-essence—[ashes?])

SH.content: how can German language receiver circumcision of poem’s date following the holocaust, the solution, the ash of all? how can you bless these ashes in German? [re: Celan]
SH.linkedContent: how can German language receiver circumcision of poem’s date following the holocaust, the solution, the ash of all? how can you bless these ashes in German? [re: Celan]

SH.content: because one can make use of shibboleth, it can be turned against oneself, the circumcised are proscribed, held at border, excluded, reduced to ashes, in the mere name
SH.linkedContent: because one can make use of shibboleth, it can be turned against oneself, the circumcised are proscribed, held at border, excluded, reduced to ashes, in the mere name

DS.content: Mallarmé: “ashes-total-gold- (cendres-or-total-),” “dispersal goldenly consumed,” or devalued, mined out, plus de nom
DS.linkedContent: Mallarmé: “ashes-total-gold- (cendres-or-total-),” “dispersal goldenly consumed,” or devalued, mined out, plus de nom

ROP.content: ash, stepping beyond psychoanalysis, radical destruction of archive, destroys capitalizing reserve, the guarding of repression
ROP.linkedContent: ash, stepping beyond psychoanalysis, radical destruction of archive, destroys capitalizing reserve, the guarding of repression

SP.content: “steps of the dove (colombe),” which is the manner of the Übermensch, leads Derrida to “pun”: we could begin a discourse on Nietzsche’s columbarium (colombaire)
SP.linkedContent: “steps of the dove (colombe),” which is the manner of the Übermensch, leads Derrida to “pun”: we could begin a discourse on Nietzsche’s columbarium (colombaire)

OTO.content: phoenix motif [in Nietzsche]: one burns what is already dead, the appearance of life, so living feminine can be reborn in these ashes [cf. EN]
OTO.linkedContent: phoenix motif [in Nietzsche]: one burns what is already dead, the appearance of life, so living feminine can be reborn in these ashes [cf. EN]

OTO.content: Derrida compares phoenix motif to Nietzsche’s call to actively destroy/forget Zarathustra, & to training methods, a treatment of the body (via tongue, ear) > must destroy selectively, the degenerate, which offers itself to annihilation, Entartung as life principle hostile to life [cf. GM]
OTO.linkedContent: Derrida compares phoenix motif to Nietzsche’s call to actively destroy/forget Zarathustra, & to training methods, a treatment of the body (via tongue, ear) > must destroy selectively, the degenerate, which offers itself to annihilation, Entartung as life principle hostile to life [cf. GM]

SW.content: letting other live: absolute suicide, no trace, not even the seal of a break
SW.linkedContent: letting other live: absolute suicide, no trace, not even the seal of a break

SW.content: not even leave them my ashes
SW.linkedContent: not even leave them my ashes

SW.content: no longer be oneself or have oneself (s’être ou s’avoir) > truth w/out truth looking for me at end of world
SW.linkedContent: no longer be oneself or have oneself (s’être ou s’avoir) > truth w/out truth looking for me at end of world

SW.content: blessing of one who leaves w/out leaving an address
SW.linkedContent: blessing of one who leaves w/out leaving an address

SW.content: Celan: “Aschenglorie (…) grub ich mich in dich und in dich” > [I in you—love itself] love made itself make love next to watching dreaming child [too old, forbidden to be old, still young]
SW.linkedContent: Celan: “Aschenglorie (…) grub ich mich in dich und in dich” > [I in you—love itself] love made itself make love next to watching dreaming child [too old, forbidden to be old, still young]

HST.content: Abraham (Gen 18: 22-32): “I who am but dust & ashes” [re: asking Lord to forgive the Sodomites]
HST.linkedContent: Abraham (Gen 18: 22-32): “I who am but dust & ashes” [re: asking Lord to forgive the Sodomites]

C.content: remainder is neither produced nor reproduced/represented [in Titus-Carmel’s coffins], classical thought re: remainder reduced to ashes > yet we retain at least more than one monumental proof (at least 127) of this historical operation
C.linkedContent: remainder is neither produced nor reproduced/represented [in Titus-Carmel’s coffins], classical thought re: remainder reduced to ashes > yet we retain at least more than one monumental proof (at least 127) of this historical operation

TN.content: Nancy: philosophy as work of mourning, work of representation, incorporation, profits from death (jouir de la mort), philosophy doesn’t know true mourning (w/out limits: ashes & tears)
TN.linkedContent: Nancy: philosophy as work of mourning, work of representation, incorporation, profits from death (jouir de la mort), philosophy doesn’t know true mourning (w/out limits: ashes & tears)

ATM.content: there is no Hegelian Phoenix after Levinas’ consummation of me [i.e. not Me] for the other [passivity more passive…], no being reborn from out the ashes
ATM.linkedContent: there is no Hegelian Phoenix after Levinas’ consummation of me [i.e. not Me] for the other [passivity more passive…], no being reborn from out the ashes

ATM.content: PLUS ASSEZ DE DIFFÉRENCE LÀ ENTRE ELLES ENTRE L’INHUMÉE OU LES CENDRES D’UN BRÛLE-TOUT
ATM.linkedContent: PLUS ASSEZ DE DIFFÉRENCE LÀ ENTRE ELLES ENTRE L’INHUMÉE OU LES CENDRES D’UN BRÛLE-TOUT

CIN.content: [quoting from PC] Derrida telling “you” [his love?] to eat all his ashes, to approach him by slowly advancing toward death, an absolute reconciliation
CIN.linkedContent: [quoting from PC] Derrida telling “you” [his love?] to eat all his ashes, to approach him by slowly advancing toward death, an absolute reconciliation

CIR.content: never been able to contradict myself, still so young [cf. SW pp. 322-23], unforgettable power of my discourse—they grind even the mute ash, name of God in the ash > so I write, convenient for forgetting
CIR.linkedContent: never been able to contradict myself, still so young [cf. SW pp. 322-23], unforgettable power of my discourse—they grind even the mute ash, name of God in the ash > so I write, convenient for forgetting

SPEC.content: cremation: a form of Fortgehen, quite singular effects on work of mourning
SPEC.linkedContent: cremation: a form of Fortgehen, quite singular effects on work of mourning
